intro: Veratrum eschscholtzii var. typicum, commonly known as the western white helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy white or pale green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are clustered in umbels. The plant contains various alkaloids, which make it toxic and unsuitable for consumption.
